Graph Generator¶

class GraphGenerator.GraphGenerator(filepath, design_loop='')¶

Bases: object

This class contains functions to draw various types of graphs

basic_info()¶

This function return basic information of the runID set (OEM, Project name, Loadcase)

Returns

  • oem_list: OEM list

  • pjtname_list: Project name list

  • loadcase_list: Loadcase list

Return type

list, list, list

belt_bracket(dataframe, column_type='loadcase_short_name', column_bar='Belt bracket force', column_line='Belt Fixation DS displacement [mm]', loadcase_name='')¶

This function plots graph for ‘belt bracket’

Parameters

  • dataframe (pandas.Dataframe) – Regular dataframe

  • column_type (str, optional) – Column name for the x axis, defaults to ‘loadcase_short_name’

  • column_bar (str, optional) – Column name for the bar chart., defaults to KW_Belt_Bracket_Force

  • column_line (str, optional) – Column name for the line chart., defaults to BFD_DS

  • loadcase_name (str, optional) – Load case name (only for multi loop mode, defaults to “”

Returns

Generated figure object

Return type

matplotlib.pyplot.figure

combine_pages(srcpages)¶

This function combines multiple pages of a PDF file in to one page

double_value_chart(dataframe: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, abs_column_name: str, vert_column_name1: str, vert_column_name2: str, title: str, xlabel: str, ylabel: str, chart_type: str) → matplotlib.pyplot.figure¶

This function generate a double value (bar/line) chart

Parameters

  • dataframe (pd.core.frame.DataFrame) – Regular dataframe

  • abs_column_name (str) – Column name for x axis

  • vert_column_name1 (str) – Column name for first y axis

  • vert_column_name2 (str) – Column name for second y axis

  • title (str) – Graph title name

  • xlabel (str) – x label name

  • ylabel (str) – y label name

  • chart_type (str) – Type of the chart (bar/line)

Returns

Generated figure object

Return type

matplotlib.pyplot.figure

front_brackets_load(dataframe: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, abs_column_name='loadcase_short_name', doorside_column_name='DS Front bracket force [kN]', tunnelside_column_name='TS Front bracket force [kN]', loadcase_name='') → matplotlib.pyplot.figure¶

This function plots graph for ‘front brackets load’

Parameters

  • dataframe (pd.core.frame.DataFrame) – Regular dataframe

  • abs_column_name (str, optional) – Column name for x axis, defaults to ‘loadcase_short_name’

  • doorside_column_name (str, optional) – Column name for first bar, defaults to FBF_DS

  • tunnelside_column_name (str, optional) – Column name for second bar, defaults to FBF_TS

  • loadcase_name (str, optional) – Load case name (only for multi loop mode), defaults to ‘’

Returns

Generated figure object

Return type

matplotlib.pyplot.figure

generate_pdf(cb_selected: list, design_loop: list, otheritems: list, page, max_per_page=6)¶

This function generates PDF file

Parameters

  • cb_selected (list) – List of integers which contains checkbox index of selected graphs types

  • design_loop (list) – List of strings which contains selected design loop

  • otheritems (list) – List of strings which contains uncommon column names

  • page – Current page selected in the menu

  • max_per_page (int, optional) – Maximum number of chart in one PDF page, defaults to 6

Returns

  • fig_list: List of matplotlib.pyplot.figure

  • savepath: Path of PDF generated

  • msg_list: List of strings which contains message

Return type

list, str, list

longitudinal_load(dataframe: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, abs_column_name='loadcase_short_name', doorside_column_name='Latch Outer force', tunnelside_column_name='Latch Inner force', loadcase_name='') → matplotlib.pyplot.figure¶

This function plots graph for ‘longitudinal load’

Parameters

  • dataframe (pandas.Dataframe) – Regular dataframe

  • abs_column_name (str, optional) – Column name for x axis, defaults to ‘loadcase_short_name’

  • doorside_column_name (str, optional) – Column name for first bar, defaults to ‘Latch Outer force’

  • tunnelside_column_name (str, optional) – Column name for second bar, defaults to ‘Latch Inner force’

  • loadcase_name (str, optional) – Load case name (only for multi loop mode), defaults to ‘’

Returns

Generated figure object

Return type

matplotlib.pyplot.figure

  • tunnelside_column_name (str, optional) – Column name for second bar, defaults to KW_Rear_Bracket_Force_TS

  • loadcase_name (str, optional) – Load case name (only for multi loop mode), defaults to ‘’

recliner_torque(dataframe: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, abs_column_name='loadcase_short_name', doorside_column_name='recliner torque DS', tunnelside_column_name='recliner torque TS', loadcase_name='') → matplotlib.pyplot.figure¶

  • abs_column_name (str, optional) – Column name for x axis, defaults to ‘loadcase_short_name’

  • doorside_column_name (str, optional) – Column name for first bar, defaults to ‘recliner torque DS’

  • tunnelside_column_name (str, optional) – Column name for second bar, defaults to ‘recliner torque TS’

  • loadcase_name (str, optional) – Load case name (only for multi loop mode), defaults to ‘’

matplotlib.pyplot.figure

This function generates a one bar chart

Parameters

  • dataframe (pd.core.frame.DataFrame) – Regular dataframe

  • abs_column_name (str) – Column name for x axis

  • vert_column_name (str) – Column name for y axis

  • title (str, optional) – Graph title name, defaults to ‘’

Returns

Generated figure object

Return type

matplotlib.pyplot.figure

  • abs_column_name (str) – Column name for x axis

  • vert_column_name (str) – Column name for y axis

two_pie_chart(column_name1='integrity', column_name2='specs')¶

Function which returns a fig object of a two pie chart

Parameters

  • column_name1 (str, optional) – Column name of ‘integrity’, defaults to ‘integrity’

  • column_name2 (str, optional) – Column name of ‘specification’, defaults to ‘specs’

Returns

Generated figure object

Return type

matplotlib.pyplot.figure

GraphGenerator.dfToDict(dataframe: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, column_key: str, column_value: str)¶

This function convert a data frame to a dictionary which contains the selected column, then returns keys and values of the dictionary

Parameters

  • dataframe (pd.core.frame.DataFrame) – Regular dataframe

  • column_key (str) – The column name which constitutes dictionary key

  • column_value (str) – The column name which constituted dictionary value

Returns

  • xs - List of dictionary keys

  • ys - List of dictionary values

Return type

list, list

GraphGenerator.get_found_column(dataframe: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, colName: str)¶

This function search the column by keyword and return the column name. If no column name is found, then return False.

Parameters

  • dataframe (pd.core.frame.DataFrame) – Regular dataframe

  • colName (str) – The column name that we want to search

Returns

The column name found, false if not found

Return type

str or bool

GraphGenerator.pie_chart(dataframe: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, column: str)¶

This function plot a pie chart

Parameters

  • dataframe (pd.core.frame.DataFrame) – Regular dataframe

  • column (str) – Column name for the pie chart

GraphGenerator.raw_double_value_chart(dataframe: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, column_type: str, vert_column_name1: str, vert_column_name2: str, chart_type='bar') → Tuple[matplotlib.pyplot.figure, list]¶

Generates raw double value (bar/line) chart

Parameters

  • dataframe (pd.core.frame.DataFrame) – Regular dataframe

  • column_type (str) – Column name for x axis

  • vert_column_name1 (str) – Column name for first y axis

  • vert_column_name2 (str) – Column name for second y axis

  • chart_type (str, optional) – Type of the chart, defaults to ‘bar’

Returns

-fig: Generated figure object -xs: List of x axis value

Return type

matplotlib.pyplot.figure, list
